lines.text: Are you happy, Blair? You don't look happy.
But do I look good?
You OK?
It's the cocaine... too much speed or something.
That's a relief.
What?
Well, you're fucked up, you look like shit, but hey no problem, all you need is a better cut of cocaine.
I was wondering if I could stay at home tonight. I'd just really like to wake up and know where the hell I am for once, it'll be a nice change of pace for me.
I can't do that.
Well I wouldn't ask, it's just my options are really kinda limited right now.
Julian, we've been through this a hundred times.
Yeah, a hundred and one, actually.
You conned your way through rehab, you lied, you stole. And look what you've done to our family.
I know, but I just want you to give me a break, I need you to be my father for one goddamn day just... just help me. I mean, can't you tell when I'm telling the truth?
No. Trust was the first thing you ruined.

[starting to cry]
Yeah.
[pause]

Okay, well I'm gonna go. There's this guy I owe a large sum of money to, yeah big surprise but, I'm gonna try and talk to him, I'm gonna try and do something right for once. I mean it. So I just want you to wish me luck, whether you believe me or not.

[voice breaking]
Julian? Can you stay clean, for one week? For one damn week? I'll do everything I can to help you. But I need you to help me too.

[with a blank stare]
I could try.
This is not recess. Everyone is accountable.
You *must* party with Julian and Blair! You must party *with* Julian and Blair! You must party with Julian *and* Blair!
Did you talk to Julian yet?
No.
Clay, I asked you to talk to him.
Okay, I'll call Betty Ford, you want me to get him a room, fine.
No, just talk to him, I mean, he's your friend, too.
It's funny. When you called me, I thought I was coming home to see you.
I mean, come on. Can't you tell when I'm telling the truth?
No. Trust was the first thing you ruined.
Julian, who the fuck do you think you're talking to? You're a junkie.
Just leave with me! There's no reason for you to stay. Not here, not in LA.
Jesus! Do I look like I'm ready for homework?
Well, don't slack off, man. Don't be a bum.
Like you?
Just like me.
Got a minute, sweetheart?
Surely.
We gots to talk business, friend.
Oh, no, all you need to do is relax. I'm gonna pay you back; all you have to do is *trust* me.
I don't wanna trust you, Julian, I just want my 50 K, all right?
Patience is next to Godliness, Rip, didn't I ever tell you that? Actually, it's the flip side of cleanliness, but it's still *pretty* fucking important if you ask me.
Then what the hell are we talking about, Julian?
We're talking about you giving me a G on spec.
No. No. No way.
Listen, listen...
You're crazy. Forget about it.
Come on. There's these girls... falling all over me... for some blow. Come on.

[pauses, hands him the coke]
This is the last time.
As soon as the club deal goes through, I'm recashing you every penny.
I hope so.
Well, don't hope... trust!
I'm real tired. I'm gonna go to bed for awhile.

[Pushes Julian]
Not here!
How about here?
We talked about this.
When? I forgot. Refresh my memory.
You can't stay here. Live your life anyway you want, but not here.
Just give me a second. You're the father, and I'm the son. I'm your *son*. I'm sleepy.
Dad?
Get out. I'll call the police.

[long pause]
Fuck you.
[Grabbing Julian, and yelling at once]
Get out of the house!
Seth, no! Leave him alone.
It's always a pleasure.
[Julian leaves]
Do you know that you girls have televisions between your legs?
Still pissed?

[pauses]
No.
Liar!
Do you have something for me?
I had it all worked out. Christ. At least I thought I did.
[long pause]
I fucked up. I don't have any money. I don't know... I don't know where I'm going to get it.

[long pause]
Julian, this cannot go on forever. You owe me a lot of cash, and I'm carrying you like I'm stupid.
I know, I know. Just... just please don't cut me off, okay?
I'm not the problem here. Julian is the problem.
